text:
What version of houdini are you using? Indie, NC, Core?
Personally I would send the alembic cache, be invoiced and then send the hip file (That's just me personally, I'm always a bit wary)

Freelancing you have to be registered as self-employed (Pretty easy on the HMRC website)
Then on my invoices I usually have an Invoice number (Up to you how you number it, but mine go YYMM_ and then I place the number of the project at the end. So 1910_01 and then 1910_02. Just helps me work out when an invoice was made. Some people just start from 0001 and work up!)
My Name and Email Address, the client's Name and Email Address, and then the work entailed. Such as :
 Sign Destruction (alembic and hip file included) - £30
 Ball Destruction (alembic and hip file included) - £20

Total: £50

And then a date to be paid by and method of payment

I can rough up an invoice of mine to give you an idea if you'd like?

Does that help and make any sense? Or do I need to try and word it better?
But I'm liking the videos! The sign looks good!
I still have Houdini educational for the moment but sidefx are giving free 6month licences to new graduates, so I should get Houdini FX early next month.
I suppose I shouldn't be selling anything until I have that license right? All perfectly clear, thanks a bunch.
Technically/Legally you shouldn't be. As your file is saved as hipnc. If you can come up with an agreement that he'll pay you, then go ahead!
